comprehensive_overview: Open MPI (Message Passing Interface) is an open-source software implementation of the Message Passing Interface standard. It is designed for high-performance computing (HPC) and is used to parallelize and optimize applications across distributed computing systems.
core_features:
1. Support for parallel computing across distributed memory systems
2. Scalability for large computing clusters
3. High performance and efficiency in message passing
4. Flexibility in configuration and customization
5. Fault tolerance and resilience in distributed computing environments
